_meta.description: Pre-computed structural decompositions for common icon concepts

components.name: lid
components.description: Closed rectangle lid, slightly wider than body

connectionRules: Ribbon pierces through lid and body - this is intentional
Bow loops meet at center point (12, 7)
Lid sits directly on top of body at y=12

components.name: headband
components.description: Arc from left to right over the top

components.name: right_earcup
components.description: Rounded rectangle on right side (mirrors left)

connectionRules: Headband ends at y=18, earcups are positioned below
Visual gap between headband and earcups - no T-intersection

components.name: cup_body
components.description: Main cup container with rounded bottom

connectionRules: Handle starts at x=17 where cup body ends
Steam lines are separate <line> elements above the cup
Handle and body share a point but are separate paths
Shaft starts at y=12 where canopy ends - no overlap
Handle connects at y=22 where shaft ends
Elements connect at endpoints, not mid-path
Lens is centered in the body
Body includes viewfinder bump via the l2-3h6l2 3 segment
Use <circle> for the lens, not a path arc
Door connects to bottom of house at y=22

components.name: heart_shape
components.description: Heart outline with two curved lobes meeting at a point

connectionRules: Central circle for the gear hub
Complex path for gear teeth around the outside
Handle extends from circle edge at ~45 degree angle
Circle is offset slightly from center (cx=11)
Head is above body with visual gap

components.name: clapper
components.description: Small circle or arc at bottom for clapper

connectionRules: Clapper hangs below the bell opening
Flap creates V pointing to center bottom
Flap connects at top edge of envelope

components.name: body
components.description: Rectangular phone body with rounded corners

components.name: screen_line
components.description: Horizontal line separating screen from body

connectionRules: Small dot or line at bottom for home button area
Single path creating crescent via overlapping circles
Uses arc commands for smooth curves
Rays are evenly spaced (45 degrees apart)
Rays don't touch the center circle
Uses arcs for puffy cloud shape
Lid sits on top of body at y=4
Tab on upper left (l2 3 creates the step)
Vertical stems connected by diagonal beam
Circular note heads at bottom of stems
Right note slightly higher than left
Shackle sits above body, connecting at y=11
Shackle is open (not fully closed arc)
Right side of shackle is disconnected/raised

components.name: teeth
components.description: Key teeth at end of blade

connectionRules: Blade extends from right side of bow
Teeth are vertical lines at end of blade
Pointed at bottom, flat at top
Pupil is centered within the eye
Diagonal line from corner to corner
Hour hand is shorter than minute hand
Hangers extend above the top edge
Arrow extends from top to near bottom
Arrow extends from bottom to near top
Left circle connects to both right circles
Lines extend from handles to cutting point
Frame contains sun and mountain scene
Sun is in upper left quadrant
Capsule at top with rounded top
Concentric arcs radiating from center bottom
Dot at bottom center represents device
Arc is open at top (horseshoe shape)
Vertical line extends from top through arc
Wider at middle, narrow at ends
Wide at top, narrow at bottom
Floppy disk shape with corner cut
Pole extends full height on left
Flag attached at top of pole
